column1: Plaisir (French pronunciation: ​[plɛziʁ]) is a commune located in the heart of the Yvelines department in the Île-de-France in north-central France. It is located in the western suburbs of Paris
column2: 29.5 km (18.3 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: It borders among others on Élancourt (south)
Plaisir has managed to preserve its twelfth century church. Its varied territory is characterised by large agricultural plains
column2: many green spaces and a forest area that together occupy half of its surface.

column1: Plaisir is the ninth commune of the Yvelines department in terms of population.
It is a member of the Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines.

column2: Plaisir has seen explosive growth in its population
column4: the town's policy has been to contain growth and aim for stabilisation
column5: in order to main the local quality of living as well as the natural spaces (forests and agricultural lands).

column1: It has a major shopping mall that is still expanding. This commercial activity has been a boon for local tax revenues
column2: but also led to congestion of its roads.
Plaisir is also home to a number of other activities
column3: for instance it is home to the Zodiaxc corporation and hosts the Lenôtre culinary school which attracts students from across the globe.

column1: Plaisir is served by two stations on the Transilien Paris – Montparnasse suburban rail line: Plaisir – Les Clayes and Plaisir – Grignon
